snippet: The severity of last week’s storm forced the department to repurpose tens of thousands of its officers, even as things were no better at home for many officers than for those they were protecting.
abstract: Severity of Hurricane Sandy forced the New York City Police Department to repurpose tens of thousands of its officers, some of whom had situations at home as bad as those of the citizens they were protecting.
lead_paragraph: The severity of last week’s storm forced the department to repurpose tens of thousands of its officers, even as things were no better at home for many officers than for those they were protecting.

headline.seo: Police Officers, Busy Rescuing Storm Victims, Were Victims Themselves
headline.main: Many Police Officers, Even as They Responded to Storm, Were Also Affected
headline.print_headline: Many Police Officers, Even as They Responded to Storm, Were Also Affected
